text: I heard back from Kingston, I have an interview on the 15th!
Great, I'm really glad to hear that you're feeling more confident already Halima!

It's always tough to talk to more than 1 person at a time... but it may well happen again. So here's some brief advice - if you'd like to discuss this in more detail, just let me know :slightly_smiling_face:

START OF INTERVIEW: Make sure you introduce yourself ("Hi, I'm Halima!") then shake hands and make eye contact with each person interviewing you in turn - repeat their names when they introduce themselves (it will help you remember!) e.g. them: "Hi, my name is Jon" you: "Hi, *Jon*" (extra tip: say their name 3 times quickly in your head to help it stick!)

DURING INTERVIEW: Focus on the person asking the question - when you respond; speak primarily to them. That means most of your eye contact will be with them. You can look at the other interviewers from time to time, but it's easier to imagine they're not as interested because they didn't ask the question... (extra tip: try to visualise that you're with a group of friends and one of them asks you about something you did yesterday... you'd respond mainly to him / her, but make sure your other friends aren't left out)

END OF INTERVIEW: When you ask *your* questions, you can be specific or generic. (1) Specific means you want to ask one of the interviews a question directly - if you can remember their name, use it! (if you can't remember, don't worry, you can ask - e.g. whilst looking at them "I'm really sorry, I want to ask you a question, but I've forgotten your name!") OR (2) Generic means you ask them all - e.g. "I'm interested in finding out about what type of group projects I might be involved in during this course... I'm not sure who's best to answer that?" (and you can scan your eyes across all of the interviewers)
Sorry that's a lot of info... let me know if its helpful and if you have any questions!!!

That's a great answer! It sounds like you constructed it really well :slightly_smiling_face: And you made sure your response was relevant to the course and things he was interested in... so really well done!!!

You should never underestimate your abilities Halima... I know I've only had a tiny insight into your life, but you've blown me away with your maturity, work ethic and ability to think critically about your own future
I can only say I wish I was like you when I was your age... and I've already messaged Dexter to tell him how impressed I am with you :slightly_smiling_face:
Ultimately it's your choice, but I think you'd excel wherever you do your degree!
Ok, I've started a few threads there... let me know if you have any questions :slightly_smiling_face:
Congratulations!! So that means you've got 2 interviews lined up, right? 13th for Westminster and 15th for Kingston? Just waiting on South Bank?
In which case, we've got a little time to prep, which is great :+1:
Let me know when you're ready and we'll work on the *STAR/AR* technique on how to answer interview questions
